organic_results.title: Evidence on the relationship between religion and educational attainment
organic_results.snippet: After arguing that previous studies have been seriously flawed in a number of ways, birth cohort data from the 1973-1978 NORC General Social Surveys are used to examine the relationship between religious background and educational attainment for both males and females during the past half century. Analysis by detailed religious categories reveals that the influence of religion has not changed over time. Its influence does not operate differently for males and females, and this absence of sex differences has remained over time. A …
